title: How to Bake Semi Sweet Chocolate Chip Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius.
Mix together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar.
Add in the eggs.
steps.description: Stir until you get a smooth paste.

steps.headline: Dissolve yeast or baking soda into the hot water.
Add this mixture to the batter.
Add fleur de sel or salt.
Add in flour in small amounts so as to facilitate the stirring.
Finish by adding chocolate chips and nuts to dough.
steps.description: Make sure to stir well at this point.

steps.headline: Use a tablespoon to make small mounds of cookie dough (about 2 inches in diameter and 3 inches apart from each other) on a sheet of baking paper (or Parchment paper).
steps.description: Place rack in the middle of the oven. If you are using two racks, then exchange the racks after half of baking time.

steps.headline: Bake for 6 minutes for golden edges and chewy center.
Bake for 8 minutes for crispy cookies.
Remove carefully so as not to break the cookies.

text: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius.  Mix together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar.  Add in the eggs. Stir until you get a smooth paste. Add the vanilla extract.  Dissolve yeast or baking soda into the hot water.  Add this mixture to the batter.  Add fleur de sel or salt.  Add in flour in small amounts so as to facilitate the stirring.  Finish by adding chocolate chips and nuts to dough. Make sure to stir well at this point. Use a tablespoon to make small mounds of cookie dough (about 2 inches in diameter and 3 inches apart from each other) on a sheet of baking paper (or Parchment paper). Place rack in the middle of the oven. If you are using two racks, then exchange the racks after half of baking time. Bake for 6 minutes for golden edges and chewy center.  Bake for 8 minutes for crispy cookies.  Remove carefully so as not to break the cookies.
